criteria: Accuracy of Matching Descriptions to Jobs
descriptions: Student is unable to match descriptions of work to job names.
Student can match one description to a job name, but with significant inaccuracies or irrelevant information.
Student can match some descriptions to job names, but with several inaccuracies or omissions.
Student accurately matches descriptions to job names for the school jobs, but struggles with local community or historical accounts.
Student accurately matches descriptions to job names for the school and local community jobs, but has minor inaccuracies with historical accounts.
Student accurately and thoroughly matches descriptions to job names across the school, local community, and historical accounts.
Student provides no relevant job examples.
Student provides one or two irrelevant job examples.
Student provides some job examples, but many are not relevant to the descriptions of work.
Student provides relevant job examples for school and local community settings, but struggles with historical examples.
Student consistently provides relevant job examples, including historical accounts, but may miss some nuances.
Student consistently provides insightful and relevant job examples across all settings, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding.
Student provides no explanations or explanations are completely unclear.
Student attempts to explain the matches, but explanations are vague and incoherent.
Student provides explanations, but they lack clarity and coherence, making it difficult to understand the rationale.
Student's explanations are generally clear and coherent for school and local community jobs, but less so for historical accounts.
Student's explanations are clear, coherent, and demonstrate a good understanding of the work and related jobs.
Student's explanations are exceptionally clear, coherent, and insightful, reflecting a deep understanding of the work, related jobs, and historical context.
